title: Crunchy Cabbage And Ramen Slaw
summary: The recipe Crunchy Cabbage And Ramen Slaw could satisfy your Japanese craving in around 45 minutes. This side dish has 329 calories, 7g of protein, and 22g of fat per serving. This dairy free recipe serves 8 and costs $1.32 per serving. 23 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is perfect for The Fourth Of July. Head to the store and pick up pepper, slivered almonds, sesame seeds, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 84%. This score is excellent. Try Crunchy Asian Ramen Cole Slaw, Crunchy Red Cabbage Slaw, and Crunchy red cabbage slaw for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are my top picks for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Gundlach Bundschu Gewurztraminer with a 4.7 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Gundlach Bundschu Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description: Fragrant aromas of white flowers, clementine and allspice burst from the glass followed by luscious flavors of Asian pear, lime, guava and passion fruit spiced with coriander. The round, plush palate is accentuated with delicately woven mineral notes and crisp acidity leading into to a long, vibrant finish. Wonderfully bright and fresh in its youth, this classic, dry Gew√ºrztraminer will continue to develop complexity up to fifteen years from vintage.
